Software Description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) is a malware family that has been used by [Deep Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0009) since at least 2015. In 2016, it was distributed via legitimate compromised Korean websites. (Citation: Cylance Shell Crew Feb 2017)
Mitigation Description: Use signatures or heuristics to detect malicious software.
Application: Consider utilizing the Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI) on Windows 10 to analyze commands after being processed/interpreted.
Use: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) obfuscates some commands by using statically programmed fragments of strings when starting a DLL. It also uses a one-byte xor against 0x91 to encode configuration data.

Software Description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) is a malware family that has been used by [Deep Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0009) since at least 2015. In 2016, it was distributed via legitimate compromised Korean websites. (Citation: Cylance Shell Crew Feb 2017)
Mitigation Description: Use capabilities to detect and block conditions that may lead to or be indicative of a software exploit occurring.
Application: Microsoft's Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) Attack Surface Reduction (ASR) feature can be used to block methods of using rundll32.exe to bypass whitelisting.
Use: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) uses rundll32 to call an exported function.

Mitigation Description: Use capabilities to detect and block conditions that may lead to or be indicative of a software exploit occurring.
Application: Microsoft's Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) Attack Surface Reduction (ASR) feature can be used to block methods of using rundll32.exe to bypass whitelisting.
Use: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) uses rundll32 to call an exported function.

Software Description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) is a malware family that has been used by [Deep Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0009) since at least 2015. In 2016, it was distributed via legitimate compromised Korean websites. (Citation: Cylance Shell Crew Feb 2017)
Mitigation Description: Restrict the ability to modify certain hives or keys in the Windows Registry.
Application: Ensure proper permissions are set for Registry hives to prevent users from modifying keys for system components that may lead to privilege escalation.
Use: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) has the ability to modify the Registry.

Software Description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) is a malware family that has been used by [Deep Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0009) since at least 2015. In 2016, it was distributed via legitimate compromised Korean websites. (Citation: Cylance Shell Crew Feb 2017)
Mitigation Description: Manage the creation, modification, use, and permissions associated to user accounts.
Application: Limit privileges of user accounts and remediate Privilege Escalation vectors so only  authorized administrators can create new services.
Use: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) establishes persistence by installing a new service pointing to its DLL and setting the service to auto-start.
